original: Beyer, Henning, jur. utr. kand., bruksägare, Orrefors, f. 17/3/84 i Karlshamn av konsul Fritz B. o. Olga Schmidt. G. 17 m. Sigrid Ekman. Barn: Margareta f. 19, g. 44 m. aff :m. Carl Otto Jacobsson, Johan 23, civ:-ing. SVR. — Stud:ex. i Växjö 02, jur. utr. kand. 07. Und:löjtn. i Andra Göta art:reg. 04, löjtn. i Smål. art:reg. res. 09, tramsp. t. Göta art :reg. 12, kapt. 19. E. o. not. i Göta hovr. 07, i Svea hovr. 10, tingstjg. i Askims, v. o. ö. Hisings, Sävedals samt Inlands doms. 07-10, aman. i civ:dep. 10, tjg. v. Gbgs råd-husr. 11-15, sekr. o. omb :man h. Gbgs drätselkamm. 15-18, gen:sekr. f. 1923 års jub :utställn. i Gbg 16-25, sekr. o. omb :manj i flera komm. styr., komm. o. beredn., bl. a. h. Gbgs byggn :nd 28-40. E. lär. i hand:rätt v. Gbgs hand:inst. 13-15. Österr. konsul 28-38. Ordf. i Blek. gille i Gbg sed. 43, led. av ’Styr. f. kuilturminnesfo^nd. Ga-tenhielm ’sed, 35, av Sv. Rominst. vänner ised. 38, verkst. dir. där sed. 47, Strömma Bom’uil’s Spinneri A-B ised. 47, led. av styr. f. olika ind:föret. o. fören., bl. a. A-B Orrefors Skogar sed. 19, A-B Orrefors Glasbruk sed. 19. RNO, KÖFOlkl, OffFrHL, RDDO, Pro PatrstGM.
translated: Beyer, Henning, jur. utr. kand., industrialist, Orrefors, b. 17/3/84 in Karlshamn to consul Fritz B. and Olga Schmidt. Married to Sigrid Ekman in 1917. Children: Margareta b. 1919, married in 1944 to Carl Otto Jacobsson, Johan b. 1923, civil engineer SVR. Passed the studentexamen in Växjö in 1902, graduated in jurisprudence in 1907. Second lieutenant in the Second Göta artillery regiment in 1904, lieutenant in the Småland artillery regiment in the reserve in 1909, transferred to the Göta artillery regiment in 1912, captain in 1919. Deputy notary in the Göta Court of Appeal in 1907, in the Svea Court of Appeal in 1910, district court judge in the Askims, Västra and Östra Hisings, Sävedals and Inland courts from 1907 to 1910, government official in 1910, worked in the Gothenburg City Court from 1911 to 1915, secretary and ombudsman for the Gothenburg Drätselkammaren from 1915 to 1918, general secretary for the 1923 Gothenburg anniversary exhibition from 1916 to 1925, secretary and ombudsman for various committees and councils, including the Gothenburg Building Committee from 1928 to 1940. Was a lecturer in commercial law at the Gothenburg Business Institute from 1913 to 1915. Was the Austrian consul from 1928 to 1938. Chairman of the Blekinge Guild in Gothenburg since 1943, member of the Board for Cultural Heritage since 1935, member of the Swedish Rome Institute Friends since 1938, executive director since 1947, member of the board of various industrial and association organizations, including Orrefors Skogar AB since 1919, Orrefors Glassworks AB since 1919. Awarded the Royal Order of the North Star, Commander of the Order of the Polar Star, Officer of the French Legion of Honor, recipient of the Royal Medal of the eighth size with Pro Patria decoration.

governmentService.governmentOffice: Askims, Västra and Östra Hisings, Sävedals and Inland courts
